greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the coefficient c appearing in the expression of the asymptotic expected shortest cycle in a random n-cyclation as c*sqrt(n).
link: Steven R. Finch, Errata and Addenda to Mathematical Constants, p. 35.
formula: (sqrt(Pi)/2)*integral_{0..infinity} exp(-x - Ei(-x)/2), where Ei is the exponential integral function.
mathematica: digits = 102; (Sqrt[Pi]/2)*NIntegrate[Exp[-x - ExpIntegralEi[-x]/2], {x, 0, Infinity}, WorkingPrecision -> digits+10] // RealDigits[#, 10, digits]& // First
xref: Cf. A143297 (analog in the case of the expected *longest* cycle in a random cyclation).
results.author: _Jean-François Alcover_, Sep 08 2014
